content:
If your company currently offers services, you may want to consider adding products to your portfolio in order to balance your offering and provide additional value to your customers. Some potential options could include:

1. Software: Your company could develop and sell software products that are related to the services you offer. This could include stand-alone applications or plugins that integrate with existing software.
2. Hardware: Depending on the services you offer, your company could also consider developing and selling hardware products that complement your services. This could include specialized equipment, sensors, or other hardware that is needed to deliver your services effectively.
3. Training materials: Many companies may be interested in training their employees on the services you offer, and you could develop and sell training materials such as manuals, guides, and videos to help them do this.
4. Consultancy services: In addition to offering services on a project-by-project basis, your company could also consider selling consultancy services on a retainer basis. This could involve providing ongoing support and guidance to help clients achieve their goals.
5. Support and maintenance: For clients who have purchased software or hardware from your company, you could offer support and maintenance services to help them keep their products up-to-date and running smoothly. This could include regular updates, bug fixes, and technical support.
